TutorialScript.TutorialStep: Prom Week characters can have complicated motivations for their behavior. Every social interaction has rippling consequences throughout the whole high school.
For example, find Lucas (he's the one with the crying hearts on his shirt) and click him.
Now find Oswald (in the tennis outfit) and click him.
Lucas and Oswald are enemies ENEMIES . Not surprisingly, Lucas wants to do entirely negative things to Oswald. Click the start enemy 'Bully' exchange above Oswald's head.
Now click 'Bully' again or the play button to start the scene.

The results window shows the changes from this interaction, including the fact that a historical record was created that Lucas did something mean to Oswald. All the characters in the game will remember this. Click the continue button.
Let's see how Oswald wants to respond. Click on him.
Now click on Lucas.
Click 'Insult.'
Now click the 'Insult' button at the bottom of the screen, between the two character name buttons, to learn more about this exchange.
The 'Motives' button in the bottom window will tell us some of the reasons Oswald wants to insult Lucas. Click it now.

Being bullied put Oswald in a generally bad mood (something negative happened to him recently) but he's also specifically upset at Lucas (who did something mean to him). Click the Play button to try the Insult.

Now Oswald has done something mean in return. If Oswald and Lucas continue to escalate their conflict, they might start being labelled as 'bullies' (a temporary status that affects how other characters feel about them) or worse. Click the continue button.
But these interactions have already changed the social state. Click on Oswald.
Now click on his friend Buzz (wearing the football jersey).
Click 'Confide In.'
Now click it again to begin the scene.
The battle with Lucas gave Oswald something new to talk about with Buzz, and having a common enemy strengthened their friendship.
Advanced Prom Week play is all about surfing the social state to play characters off each other. Make one character friends with his girlfriend's buddies to boost her opinion of him...
...or repair a traitor's sullied reputation through random acts of kindness. The sky's the limit!
